docs.snippet: United States exports to Latin America this year probably will fall below those of 1951, but the reduction is likely to be less than expected, according to an analysis released over the week-end by the National Foreign Trade Council.

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 -- A tour of the Far East by the president-elect of the United States, between his election in November and his inauguration in January, was advocated today as a means of building good neighbor relations between the United States and Southeast Asia.

docs.snippet: THE Royal Institute of International Affairs (Chatham House, as everybody calls it from the name of its London headquarters) is performing a notable service to students of Latin America. These two little books on Chile and Uruguay are the first in a...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE Royal Institute of International Affairs (Chatham House, as everybody calls it from the name of its London headquarters) is performing a notable service to students of Latin America. These two little books on Chile and Uruguay are the first in a projected series.

docs.snippet: BROOKLINE, Mass., Aug. 18 (AP) -- While the Australian defenders, Frank Sedgman and Ken McGregor, sat out the first round with a bye, the men's division of the National Doubles Tennis tournament went through the opening paces with only a minor upset...
docs.lead_paragraph: BROOKLINE, Mass., Aug. 18 (AP) -- While the Australian defenders, Frank Sedgman and Ken McGregor, sat out the first round with a bye, the men's division of the National Doubles Tennis tournament went through the opening paces with only a minor upset today at Longwood.

docs.snippet: Rapid changes are being made in the world's steel map. World output in 1951 was 230,512,000 tons, with Soviet Russia and her satellites responsible for 19.7 per cent. According to United Nations estimates, the 1953 figure will be 266,453,000 tons,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Rapid changes are being made in the world's steel map. World output in 1951 was 230,512,000 tons, with Soviet Russia and her satellites responsible for 19.7 per cent. According to United Nations estimates, the 1953 figure will be 266,453,000 tons, with the Iron Curtain countries supplying 20.7 per cent.
docs.abstract: W Eur output put at 72,039,000 tons, '53; tops USSR bloc output despite gain by latter; table

headline.main: Changes Under Way in World Steel Map; United Nations Estimates Iron Curtain Countries' Percentage Will Rise

docs.snippet: THE Pan American Union's Philatelic Division, which had its twelfth birthday a few months ago, set a new high monthly sales record during July, and the boom has been continuing through August without the customary summertime recession.

docs.snippet: Haiti, Nicaragua and Panama rate the highest of all Latin-American countries for credits and collections among United States exporters, according to a survey conducted by the Foreign Credit Interchance Bureau. The survey, covering the first six...
docs.lead_paragraph: Haiti, Nicaragua and Panama rate the highest of all Latin-American countries for credits and collections among United States exporters, according to a survey conducted by the Foreign Credit Interchance Bureau. The survey, covering the first six months of 1952, showed the three top countries which enjoyed identical ratings were followed closely by Mexico, the Dominican Republic and Cuba.

headline.main: CREDIT LISTING TIES 3 LATIN COUNTRIES; Haiti, Nicaragua and Panama Rate Highest for 6 Months, Followed by Mexico
